snippet: The Police Department could not immediately provide an explanation for the shooting of a man, whose hands, a witness said, were on the steering wheel of his car.
abstract: New York City Police Detective Hassan Hamdy shoots and kills unarmed man Noel Polanco, who had been pulled over on the Grand Central Parkway in Queens; witnesses say Polanco, whose hands were both on the steering wheel, was given no time to comply with orders to put his hands up before he was shot; Police Department officials have no immediate explanation for the latest in a series of fatal shootings.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and WENDY RUDERMAN
byline.contributor: Alain Delaquérière and Alex Vadukul contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Police Department could not immediately provide an explanation for the shooting of a man, whose hands, a witness said, were on the steering wheel of his car.

headline.main: Police Fatally Shoot an Unarmed Driver on the Grand Central Parkway
headline.print_headline: Police Fatally Shoot an Unarmed Driver on the Grand Central Parkway
